title: So are we just gonna ignore HOW GP got his new arm?
body:
_"Despite receiving horrific injuries in the explosion, Gangplank survived. Sporting a multitude of fresh scars, **and with a newly crafted metal arm to replace his amputated limb**, he is now determined to rebuild his strength, reclaim what he sees as rightfully his, and ruthlessly punish all of those who turned against him."_

Question... And this an important one... How did he get this? Did he always have a metal arm lying around? Did he have the doctor who cut off his old arm sew on the metal one? Did he take a damn dingy to Zaun and hold Viktor at gunpoint to make him it? I HAVE SO MANY QUESTIONS!!!

replies.body: With the amount of violence in Bilgewater, they probably sell prosthetic limbs at convenience stores.
On that note Gangplank's prosthetic is likely very painful as it'll be attached to bone and nerves. Yeouch.

He ain't got time to feel pain, there's just too much to do. Like nailing MF's ass to a burning log.

Edit: Lol I didn't type this

>
> He ain't got time to feel pain, there's just too much to do. Like nailing MF's ass to a burning log.

Or MF X GP, rule bilgewater together
pretty sure that ship just blew up.

> [{quoted}](name=macromite,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=IT9yq9yR,comment-id=00030000000000010000,timestamp=2015-08-03T03:19:45.540+0000)
>
> pretty sure that ship just sunk to Bilgewater's depths.

Fixed.
nah

Got a dame to maim, some men to shoot, some gangs brought back in order, some thefts to be resolved, debts to be collected, a Harrowing to prepare for...

Damn Gangplank just can't catch a break.

At first I read this and thought:

http://25.media.tumblr.com/tumblr_kzdowtchv51qzw0lho1_400.jpg

And then I read "Like nailing MF's ass" and my brain just shut off and starting thinking a bit off topic.

I actually got a bit disappointed reading the rest of it.
he just ate oranges and it was k
He ain't got time to feel pain, there's just too much to do. Like nailing MF's ass to a burning log.
_"Gentlemen, we can rebuild him. We have the technology."_

{{champion:6}}
Man, they sure fucked that one up.
I guess aesthetics wasn't on their list of priorities.

Problem is they're a bit lacking in the functionality department as well.

How does he even shit?

Fixed that for you.
Well obviously if you're going to try and buy a Christmas present for the pirate who has already stolen everything you have to get creative.....
I'm sure you can get a lot things on the Bligewater black market
He probably stole the thing with brute force. I'd imagine his new {{item:3742}} was obtained the same way.
He probably always wanted it attached, but is just now getting the perfect opportunity to >.>

> [{quoted}](name=Valkyrie Witch,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=IT9yq9yR,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-08-03T01:28:33.669+0000)
>
> He probably always wanted it attached, but is just now getting the perfect opportunity to >.>

now that you say it... in the epilogue stand that he looked at his arm and said that everything has a purpose... maybe he meant that now his metal arm would come to a use? maybe he really had it all the time... being a pirate captain in his best Business means that you are facing many dangerous moments like loosing an arm in a fight so he was prepared? ALL THIS THEORIES

Didnt the last part of burning tides was about how GP got patched up by a doctor? 
"He pulled something from the case, and threw it to the doctor’s feet. There, glinting under the lantern was the clean steel of a bonesaw." - burning tides epilogue.

Yea he didnt say he got his arm, just cut it off, but i dont think it's hard to believe he just got it from some illegal doctor work or something

Yea it's a little odd. I thought it'd be something that was looted and not crafted. Who knows what other black market goodies are laying around. Maybe modified to tolerate Gangplank's physical strength..

Maybe his artistic hobby of scrimshaw on 'live canvasses' brought about desperately summing up anatomy knowledge  in assembling a mechanical limb ... but probably not without some assistance (the doctor). He seemed confident in losing his arm anyway.

I think its a subtle reference to Hextech Sion legacy skin. Where does Hextech come from? Zaun. A first generation Zaunite tech looted years ago, maybe?
